R & D

R & D Cell
Research & Development
The R&D cell at our engineering college serves as the nerve center of innovation, exploration, and academic excellence. With a focus on fostering a culture of research and development, our cell is dedicated to pushing the boundaries of knowledge and driving technological advancement. Led by experienced faculty members and supported by enthusiastic students, we undertake interdisciplinary projects, collaborate with industry partners, and engage in cutting-edge research endeavors. Our goal is to not only contribute to the academic community but also to address real-world challenges and make meaningful societal impact. Join us in our quest to innovate, discover, and shape the future.
Vision
"To cultivate an environment of innovation and excellence, driving transformative research and development that addresses global challenges and fosters sustainable societal progress."
Mission
To encourage and facilitate the students, research scholars and faculty to involve in research activities addressing real-world challenges.
Drive interdisciplinary research through R&D projects by collaborating with academia and industry.
Research and Development Team
Dr. Anil Tumuluri (R&D chief coordinator) (Asst. Prof, H&S-PhD (University of Hyderabad), Postdoctoral Fellow (IIT Bombay))
Mr. Mohammed Afzal (Publication and Research- coordinator) (Assistant Professor, AIML)
Mr. V. Sharath Vedala (Innovation and Patents-coordinator)
Mr. I. Phani Raja (Computer Science and Engineering-Mentor) (Assistant Professor, CSE)
Mr. Neelesh D. Mhaiskar (Data Science-Mentor) (Assistant Professor, DS)
Mrs. P. Sandhya Rani (Cyber security-Mentor) (Assistant Professor, CS))
Research Infrastructure
Muffle furnace with temperature up to 800 oC.
Laboratory Hot air Oven.
Humidity chamber.
Auto clave for composite and nanoparticle synthesis.
Dedicated Apple lab with high end iMac configuration.
Open source software tools available for Research:
Python:
A versatile programming language widely used for scientific computing, machine learning, and data analysis.
R:
Another popular language for statistical computing and graphics, commonly used in data mining and analysis.
TensorFlow:
An open-source machine learning framework developed by Google, widely used for building and training neural networks.
PyTorch:
A deep learning framework developed by Facebook's AI Research lab, known for its flexibility and ease of use.
Jupyter Notebooks:
Interactive computing environments that allow users to create and share documents containing live code, equations, visualizations, and narrative text.
Apache Hadoop:
A framework for distributed storage and processing of large datasets commonly used in big data analytics.
Apache Spark:
A fast and general-purpose cluster computing system for big data processing, supporting various programming languages including Java, Scala, and Python.
LaTeX:
A typesetting system commonly used for writing technical and scientific documents, particularly for research papers and academic publications.
OpenCV:
An open-source computer vision and machine learning software library, providing tools for image processing, object detection, and more.
Docker:
A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers, offering flexibility and consistency across different computing environments.
Apache Kafka:
A distributed event streaming platform used for building real-time data pipelines and streaming applications.
Apache Flink:
A stream processing framework for real-time analytics and event-driven applications.
PostgreSQL:
Another open-source relational database management system, known for its advanced features and extensibility.
Apache Cassandra:
A distributed NoSQL database designed for handling large amounts of data across multiple commodity servers.
Scikit-learn:
A machine learning library for Python, providing simple and efficient tools for data mining and data analysis.
Open source software tools available for Plagiarism
Turnitin (SimCheck):
While Turnitin is a commercial plagiarism detection service; it offers SimCheck, a freely available version for educational institutions. It provides similarity checking and originality reports.
Moss (Measure of Software Similarity):
Originally developed for detecting plagiarism in programming assignments, Moss is widely used in academia. It supports various programming languages and can detect similarities in source code.
Plagiarism Checker X:
This tool is designed for educators, students, and content creators. It can compare documents against a large database and provides detailed reports on similarities found.
MoUs
Visual IT software solutions, Hyderabad
Bharat Blockchain Network
International Institute of Information Technology, Gachibowli (on virtual lab)
Federation of Telangana Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FTCCI)
Morphological Solutions pvt. Ltd., Hyderabad
Talent Battle private ltd., Pune, Maharashtra.
World Academy of Research in Science and Technology, Coimbatore, Tamilnadu.

R & D
-
NEWGEN IEDC
About IEDC
Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Centre (IEDC) is the programme launched by National Science and Technology Entrepreneurship Development Board (NSTEDB), Department of Science & Technology (DST), Government of India and implemented by EDII, Ahmedabad. NewGen IEDC aims to inculcate the spirit of innovation and entrepreneurship amongst the young S&T students, encourage and support start-up creation through guidance, mentorship & support. NewGen IEDCs would be established in academic institutions where students will be encouraged to take up innovative projects with possibility of commercialization.
NewGen IEDCs would also spread the message of entrepreneurship and create a culture of entrepreneurship in the Host Institution (HI). With faculty already trained in the nuances of entrepreneurship, the presence of IEDCs in HI would create a vibrant entrepreneurial culture amongst the students. Few amongst the “Job-Seekers” would be converted to “JobGenerators” through the entrepreneurial route.
About Sphoorthy IEDC
Sphoorthy Engineering College firmly believes in Innovation as the key to ignite novel ideas and critical thinking in young engineers, to address various complex engineering and societal challenges. In the year 2017, It is the only college in Telangana got a grant for the establishment of New Generation Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Centre (NewGen IEDC) approved by Department of Science & Technology (DST) under the aegis of National Science and Technology Entrepreneurship Development Board (NSTEDB) and Entrepreneurship Development Institute of India (EDII). The NewGen IEDC ensures each innovative student idea gets a prototype fund of Rs. 2,50,000 and a total of 2.3 crore for 85 Student projects.
Salient features of IEDC:
It is a five-year programme to be implemented in an educational institution
A maximum of twenty new projects per Institution would be supported in a year
The projects should be students’ projects with a high degree of innovation and commercial viability to lead to possible start-up by students
As far as possible, the projects should be multi-disciplinary in nature and to be executed by teams consisting of students drawn from various levels.
Functions of IEDC:
To motivate, support and mentor students for identification, development, and commercialization of their innovative ideas
To initiate targeted number of innovative student projects each year for new product development
To organize Business Plan Competitions/Innovation Camps/ Hackathons with active involvement of industry and alumni
To guide and assist prospective entrepreneurs on various aspects such as preparing project reports, obtaining project approvals, loans and facilities from agencies of support system, technologies information, etc.
To arrange interaction with entrepreneurs, bankers, professionals, potential customers and create a mentorship scheme for student innovators
To facilitate creation of entrepreneur’s club / E-Cells in the college to foster culture of entrepreneurship amongst students
Activities Performed During the years:
Workshop on Idea Generation and Innovation
Entrepreneurship Awareness Camp (EAC)
Entrepreneurship Awareness Program by Sphoorthy NewGen IEDC
Workshop on Design Thinking
Workshop on Patents
Smart India Hackathon Participation
Workshop on Business Plan
Workshop on Team Building Essentials
Workshop on Leadership & Management
IDEATHON- Innovative Idea competition
Students participation in Chinna Shodana Yatra in Assocation with Palle Srujana
Awareness program by NEN Mentors to the Students.
Project Expo By Sphoorthy Engineering College Students
Training programs on Advanced technologies (IOT, DRONES, ROBOTICS, ANDROID ,3D PRINTING
Innovation Expo organized by Sphoorthy NewGen IEDC in association with Palle Srujana
student’s participation in “Entrepreneurship Development Program for Student Entrepreneurs” by NAARM
Facilities Available:
Robotic Lab.
Fab Lab with Mechanical and Electrical Components.
Expert Mentors in each emerging technology domain.
R & D Engineers to support student innovations.
External Industry Association to guide student Innovations.
Industrial grid 3D Printer.
Co2 based Laser Cutting Facility.
Advanced Wi-Fi Hotspot setup for students to work on IoT related projects.

Centre for Excellence
Dr A.P.J Abdul Kalam Centre For Excellence
Sphoorthy Engineering college established Dr A.P.J ABDUL KALAM CENTER FOR EXCELLENCE in the year 2015 to educate students on Continuous Value-Added Programs & promote Innovation and Entrepreneurship practices within the campus.
In the Year 2017, Sphoorthy Engineering College received a grant from Govt of India under ministry of Science and Technology & DST (Dept. of Science and Technology), which Sanctioned NEW GEN IEDC (Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Centre) with 2.87 Crores during the year of 2017 for a duration of 5 years. The funds are to be used towards 85 Student Innovative projects under NIDHI (National Initiative for Developing and Harnessing Innovations)
Advanced Technologies Training
Robotics  training and projects by in-house faculty and Association ROBOLAB.
IOT-Raspberry Pertaining by trained faculty and Association with LABWIRE TECH.
Android mobile application development training by in-house faculty.
3-D printing training by In-house faculty.
Drones training by in-house faculty.
Associations
Associated with TASK Telangana Academy for Skill and Knowledge to promote SKILL DEVELOPMENT activities.
Associated with IOT MAKER SPACE & ISB-TEP to promote Technology entrepreneurship programs.
Associated with ORACLE ACADEMY to promote certification programs on ORACLE SQL & ORACLE JAVA.
Associated with CISCO ACADEMY to promote certification program on CCNA, IT ESSENTIALS, IOT, PYTHON ETC
Associated CAMBRIDGE ENGLISH to promote certification program on BUSINESS ENGLISH COMMUNICATION.
Associated INTERNSHALA to promote internship for students.
INSTITUTIONAL Membership with IUCEE – INDO Universal Consortium for Engineering Education to promote transforming engineering education & Outcome based education.
INSTITUTIONAL Membership with ISBA-Indian Science & Technology Entrepreneur park and Business Incubator Association to promote TECHNICAL BUSINESS INCUBATION activities in the COLLEGE.
SAMSUNG DIGITAL ACADEMY NODAL CENTER to give training on SAMSUNG TIZEN mobile app development.
GEDC-Global Engineering Dean’s Council member to be part of Global Engineering Education.
Executing Govt of India Program PMKVY on ASSISTANT ELECTRICIAN job role under CONSTRUCTION Skill Sector Council.

AICTE IDEA Lab
R & D
-
AICTE IDEA LAB
AICTE New Delhi sanctioned IDEA lab to Sphoorthy Engineering College. AICTE- Idea Lab is a creative and innovative space or program designed to foster the generation, development, and realization of new ideas, inventions, or projects. These labs bring together individuals with diverse skills and backgrounds to collaborate on creative projects. The Chief Mentor (Principal), Coordinator and Co-coordinator have attended many brain storming sessions at Delhi, Pune and Bangalore.
With IDEA lab facilities, students and faculty will be encouraged to take up creative work and, in the process, get training on creative thinking, problem solving, collaboration etc.
AICTE IDEA LAB Sanction Letter
Procurement of Equipments:

We request you to provide the best Equipment in terms of Quality, Performance and Long Life with 2years warranty and AMC on Equipment’s. The last date for submitting Quotations is
